channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. deports dozens of migrants to Ukraine amid war
item.description: Immigration lawyers say those deported to Ukraine could be conscripted to fight in the war, contrary to international laws that prohibit deportations ...

item.title: Trump defends Saudi crown prince over question about killing of Khashoggi
item.description: President Trump lashed out a reporter in the Oval Office who was asking about allegations the crown prince orchestrated the killing of Washington Post...

item.title: Kamala Harris Hits Campaign Trail in Tennessee Special Election
item.description: On Tuesday, the former vice president made her first campaign appearance for another Democrat since leaving office.

item.title: Judge sides with Meta in antitrust trial, will not spin off WhatsApp and Instagram
item.description: A federal judge ruled against the Federal Trade Commission's antitrust suit alleging that Meta had stifled competition by buying up its rivals.

item.title: Federal Court Blocks Texas’ Republican-Friendly Congressional Map
item.description: The move dealt a blow to efforts by Texas Republicans and President Trump to flip Democratic seats in the state. Gov. Greg Abbott said the state would...

item.title: On Republican Neo-Nazism, Hamas and Israel: An Epidemic of Moral Cowardice
item.description: People with extreme ideology don’t care anymore about hiding their excesses or their agendas. It’s all out there online or on YouTube.

item.title: Trump administration shares new moves to dismantle more of the Education Department
item.description: Opponents of the changes say Congress explicitly located some of these offices inside the Education Department, and the White House cannot legally mov...

item.title: Trump Administration Announces Steps to Dismantle Education Department
item.description: Responsibilities for K-12 and college programs, among others, will be moved to other federal agencies.

item.title: The Three Republican Women Who Defied Trump on Epstein
item.description: Lauren Boebert, Marjorie Taylor Greene and Nancy Mace resisted pressure from the president and made the vote to release the Epstein files possible.

item.title: Farewell, fair penny. You are finished, but never forgotten
item.description: This tiny disc of zinc with just a smidge of copper has played an outsized role in our national (and international) discourse. The U.S. Mint ended pro...

item.title: Live Updates: Trump Praises Saudi Prince and Dismisses Question About Killing of Journalist
item.description: Hosting Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, President Trump brushed off the murder of Jamal Khashoggi by Saudi agents, saying, “Things happen.” Fighter ...

item.title: U.S. Military Threat Puts Spotlight on Venezuela’s Allies
item.description: American adversaries are unlikely to help President Nicolás Maduro of Venezuela fend off a concerted attack. But they have made toppling him harder.

item.title: Investigating a Recycling Disaster
item.description: We went to Nigeria, where recycling plants are extracting lead for use in American and European car batteries — at a terrible human cost.

item.title: The Auto Industry’s Lead Recycling Program is Poisoning People
item.description: We documented the toxic fallout of a green technology.

item.title: The Saudi crown prince receives an especially warm welcome at the White House.
